intro: Ateleia albolutescens, commonly known as the white-veined evergreen. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with prominent white veins. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Ateleia albolutescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests.
